statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

article.description: Dylan Smith scored the game-winning jump shot at the buzzer and UNC Asheville defeated Furman 67-65 Tuesday night.
article.headline: UNC Asheville outlasts Furman 67-65 with buzzer-beater
article.linkText: UNC Asheville outlasts Furman 67-65 with buzzer-beater
article.story: ASHEVILLE, N.C. -- Dylan Smith scored the game-winning jump shot at the buzzer and UNC Asheville defeated Furman 67-65 Tuesday night. Smith and Furman's Stephen Croone battled in the final minute. Croone scored Furman's last five points -- pulling the Paladins from a point behind to a one-point lead, and then a 65-65 tie with 21 seconds left. Smith, for his part, scored the last seven points for UNC Asheville (8-5). His two free throws broke a 60-60 tie, a 3-pointer with 28 seconds to play put the Bulldogs up 65-63, and his mini-run ended with the game-winner as time expired. Kevin Vannatta scored 21 points and Smith 20 for UNC Asheville. Croone and Devin Sibley scored 16 each to lead Furman (6-7). Furman reeled off six unanswered points -- Matt Rafferty on a jumper and a 3, and Sibley a free throw -- to tie at 60-60 with under two minutes left.
